text: Psalm 71
A Prayer to God the Rock of Refuge
In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame.
In your righteousness deliver me and rescue me;
incline your ear to me and save me.
Be for me a rock of refuge to resort to always;
you have ordained\f + \fr 71:3 \ft Or “commanded” \f* to save me,
because you \add are\add* my rock and my fortress.
My God, rescue me from \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* wicked,
from \add the\add* ⸤grasp⸥\f + \fr 71:4 \ft Literally “palm” \f* of \add the\add* evildoer and \add the\add* oppressor,
because you \add are\add* my hope,
O Lord Yahweh, my confidence from my youth.
Upon you I have leaned ⸤from birth⸥.\f + \fr 71:6 \ft Literally “from the belly” \f*
\add It was\add* you who ⸤took⸥\f + \fr 71:6 \ft Literally “cut,” that is, the umbilical cord \f* me from the womb of my mother.
My praise \add is\add* of you continually.
I have become a wonder to many,
but you \add are\add* my strong refuge.
My mouth is filled with your praise,
with your glory all the day.
Do not cast me away in the time of old age;
when my strength fails do not abandon me.
For my enemies talk concerning me,
and those who watch for my life conspire together,
saying, “His God has abandoned him.
Pursue and seize him, because there is no deliverer.”
O God, do not be far from me.
My God, hurry to help me.
Let them be ashamed; let them perish
who are ⸤my adversaries⸥.\f + \fr 71:13 \ft Literally “adversaries of my soul” \f*
Let \add them\add* wrap themselves with scorn and disgrace
who seek my harm.
But as for me, I will hope continually
and increase your praise.
My mouth will tell of your righteousness,
your salvation ⸤all day long⸥,\f + \fr 71:15 \ft Literally “all the day” \f*
though I do not know \add the full\add* sum \add of them\add*.
I will come in \add to tell\add* the mighty deeds of Lord Yahweh.
I will ⸤make known⸥\f + \fr 71:16 \ft Literally “bring to remembrance” \f* your righteousness, yours only.
O God, you have taught me from my youth,
and up to now I have proclaimed your wonderful deeds.
And even when \add I am\add* old and gray,
O God, do not abandon me
until I proclaim your ⸤strength⸥\f + \fr 71:18 \ft Literally “arm” \f* to \add this\add* generation,
your power to every \add one that\add* comes \add after\add*.
And your righteousness, O God, \add is\add* to \add the\add* height \add of heaven\add*.
You who have done great things,
O God, who \add is\add* like you?
You who have caused me\f + \fr 71:20 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* to see many troubles and evils,
you will again revive me.\f + \fr 71:20 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f*
And from the depths of the earth
you will again bring me up.
You will increase my greatness,
and you will comfort me all around.\f + \fr 71:21 \ft A slightly different vocalization yields, “… comfort me again”; compare the LXX. \f*
On my part, I will praise you with a stringed instrument,
\add and\add* your faithfulness, O my God.
I will sing praises to you with a lyre,
O Holy One of Israel.
My lips will sing for joy when I sing praises to you,
and my soul, which you have redeemed.
My tongue also
will speak of your righteousness all the day,
because they have been put to shame, because they have been humiliated
who seek my harm.
